name: Cite Your Sources!
description:
Cite Your Sources is a party game for 3-6 players. You need to convince your friends to take your side on the real issues of our time, including  how to pronounce ".gif" and whether cats or dogs make better pets. No arguments can stand alone, though - once per round, your competitor can demand to see a source, and whatever that source ends up being, you have to work it in. Socrates? Gandhi? Colbert? All possibilities. The judge awards a point to the best argument, and after everyone debates twice, the person with the most points wins.

Made in a day for the Extra Credits "passage" jam. My original idea was dramatically over-scoped and honestly didn't have a whole lot to do with the theme, so I had to revert to my backup. I think it turned out pretty well, all things considered.
